title: Introducing: Female Band
content:
There’s not a huge amount to be said about Female Band because there doesn’t seem to be a whole lot of information on her, yet as all good music, her creativity speaks for itself.

What I was able to glean is that her name is Anna Vtorova and she released her two track EP on Mancunian label Haus of Pins back in mid-September. The name of the EP is Jacksonville and consists of two tracks, He Takes Her On The Dance Floor and Jacksonville. Both show an incredible talent despite their seemingly simple repetitive nature, especially on Jacksonville, this dark menacing chord vibrates through you as her distorted voice seeps through the lo-fi fog. On He Takes Her On The Dance Floor it’s almost impossible to hear her soft-spoken voice through the completely distorted and glitchy bass manipulation. According to the only interview I could find with her, she draws a lot of influence from trip-hop and bass artists, such as Massive Attack, Portishead, Raime, Alva Noto and more. This is her 2nd EP, having released her first on Italian Beach Babe Records entitled Good Bye New York, Forever. With 2014 fast approaching, it’ll be fascinating to witness what she comes up with in the new year, especially with such a diverse and innovative sound. Give a listen to both EPs below:
